abstract: Even as it actively promotes its democratic values around the world, the United States has also been building massive, expensive, fortress-like embassies that are often seen as anything but open and welcoming. In these troubled times, can a safe embassy also be an accessible one? Can tight security and elegant design co-exist?

headline.main: Must All U.S. Embassies Now Be Fortresses?
